name: Nokia AI/ML & Full-stack Intern
description: Built a cloud-native multi-agent LLM system with RAG-driven chain-of-thought analysis and MCP-based network reconfiguration to autonomously resolve 5G network issues.

name: Undergraduate Research Assistant
description: Designed privacy-preserving inference algorithms and defense mechanisms leveraging cryptography, differential privacy, and machine learning, under Dr. Florian Kerschbaum.

name: Nokia AI/ML & Automation Intern
description: Developed autonomous applications based on the OODA control loop for next-gen telecommunications networks, focusing on UPF congestion and network slice management to approach an L5 autonomous network.

name: UWARG Embedded Flight Software Developer & Project Manager
description: Project manager on the embedded flight software (EFS) team in the University of Waterloo Aerial Robotics Group. Worked on firmware and embedded systems for the autonomous UAVs.

name: UW CSC Events Coordinator
description: Plan and execute large-scale events that benefit students interested in CS, ranging from social events to fun competitions to professional networking.

name: WOSS CS Club Executive
description: Created and taught weekly C++ lessons on graph theory, dynamic programming, and data structures for 80-100 club members, alongside leading live problem-solving sessions.

name: Michigan Math and Science Scholars
description: Attended an invitational, residential math program held by the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. Learned about graduate-level STEM topics in pure mathematics such as topology, set theory, and Brouwer's Fixed Point Theorem through rigorous coursework taught by university faculty.

name: HDSB Hackathon Director of Outreach
description: Helped organize the first-ever hackathon under HDSB for over 200 individual participants. Raised over $8000 in sponsorships for prizes.

name: Bronze Cross
description: Attended an Assistant Lifeguard Bronze Cross Certification and Standard First Aid certification program. Developed leadership and communication skills with fellow lifeguards.

name: CyberSeniors Volunteer
description: Led online seminars about technology (approx. 30 seniors), engaged seniors through group discussion, mentored seniors in one-on-one support calls.
